content.description: On West side of Tomato Rock under clean yellow orange wall is a traverse on buckets. A left to right traverse, SLAP with a nice top out at corner.
content.location:
N40 17.191 W105 21.588.

On -> West <- side of Tomato Rock summit under beautiful, clean, yellow-orange wall.

content.description: Traverse up and left on incuts. At the end, proceed up and right on a thin flake under overhang to a big topout on small holds. Classic.
content.location:
N40 17.061 W105 21.595

Above Giant Pink Slab maybe 283 feet is a OH face.

First part is a close to the ground traverse, similar to grotto in that you can step back with a foot to keep from falling back down traverse.

Above traverse is OH wall with brown dead stump at top (dead tree has finally fallen down). I would trust the stump, when you top out.

content.description: Climb the stellar hand crack in corner up the sloping ramp and over small corner, classic.
content.location: At top of Tomato Rock on North side are two crack climbs, this is on the west side climbers right of the two.

content.description: Climb the short hand and finger OH crack, top out to right or continue few feet further south to another hand crack.
content.location: At summit of Tomato Rock on North side are two cracks this is the East crack climber's left.

content.description:
Rock faces South and sports 3 easy 5.8ish problems,

From left is Whale mouth like feature OW.

Middle climb goes up arch under roof and is classic!

Third on right starts in corner, up crack and to left top out on big holds.

A 11ish short boulder problem goes up downclimb to right of middle problem.
content.location:
N40 17.041 W105 21.542.

Rock is above stream about 100 - 200 feet, near sign that reads National Forest Property behind this sign.

pathTokens: North Fork of the St. Vrain River
